title: Who is the most surprising candidate on Hillary's VP short list? - Quora
tags: Hillary Clinton Running Mate Speculation (2016 campaign)

response.answer_text: I’m extremely surprised you didn’t even mention Bernie Sanders in that list.Yes I do agree, it is a long shot. But one must also agree it would be one hell of a ticket.Imagine the response of the crowd.Dems and Independents would go nuts.For at least a few days I can sure as hell say,people would stop talking about Trump. Like in any prospective ticket, There are pros and cons. Let’s see them,shall we? Sanders is a Socialist. To many Americans, A Socialist refers to the Soviet Union and the remnants of the Cold war.But people do embrace programs like social security . It is not a social program?Many in the cable news media said Sanders was a fringe candidate. An Independent Senator from Vermont whom nobody knew.I’m quite sure that opinion has been blown out of the water now.He might as well be more popular than Clinton among many sections of the people.He has no hunger for power unlike Clinton,So he is a perfect candidate for VP.Clinton didn’t consider the VP option back in 2008 because she needed a bigger role. As most of us know secretary of state is more prominent than the VP in terms of governance.She should pick Elizabeth Warren/Bernie Sanders for a victory in November.

All sanity aside, which seems to be the hallmark of this election, Clinton should step aside and nominate Warren for the presidency. Warren can then nominate Clinton for VP, an arrangement that’s far more balanced. If Hillary is still determined to run for the presidency, she’s going to need a showy, solidly-establishment VP — and no one in that short list fills the bill. This leak looks strategic. It makes you wonder more who’s not on it. For those who are on it, it’s Hillary giving them national exposure; something they can express their gratitude and loyalty for later.
